brief.brief: The Select command panel selects records that satisfy a query.
You can sort the selected records by any field or fields. The first record in the list is immediately available for processing.

detail.detail: File: (file variable) Specify the file variable to select records from. Usually, the file variable has been initialized with the rinit panel
Query: (Boolean) Type an SQL query expression that specifies the criteria for selecting records from the source table.

Sort Fields: (array of characters) Specify the names of the fields to use to sort the selected records by. If these sort fields are filled in, the query uses this as the key, and response time may be adversely affected.
Exit if No Records Selected: (label) Specify the exit to take if there are no records that match the selection criteria.
Exit if One Record Selected: (label) Specify the exit to take if there is one record that matches the selection criteria.
You can sort on one or more fields.
You can sort on keys only.
To use a predefined key of multiple fields, you must indicate the same field names in the same order as entered in the dbdict.
Service Manager parses the SQL query field at run time.
Since parameter variables cannot be parsed at run time, query expressions with parameter variables must be input in a special manner.
The procedure is to put in an expression, parsed at run time, which generates a string at run time, with no local variables.

If the local variable $menu.name contains the value MAIN MENU at run time, this will result in the Query: name="MAIN MENU".
If you specifically sort on a key that allows NULL entries, you will not retrieve any records whose key is NULL.
These records are not in the index.
